title: Understanding and Managing Teacher Self-Report Bias in Educational Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Corporate Training Program Experience, Understanding of Core Educational Technology Concepts
context.additional_context: Focuses on identifying cognitive biases that occur when administrators analyze teacher self-report data and strengthening strategic thinking for practical educational implementation

learning_goals: Identify three or more types of self-presentation bias that appear in survey-based self-report assessments

Analyze the potential for bias across six educational technology domains (instructional design, assessment, learner-centered instruction, curriculum alignment, attitudes toward computers, and computer use with students) in context-specific scenarios
Propose two or more objective evaluation methods using VR simulation to compensate for the limitations of self-report data

resources: VR Scenarios for Six Educational Technology Domains

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
